snippet: The oil minister, Rostam Qasemi, acknowledged that petroleum exports and sales had fallen by at least 40 percent over the past year, contradicting his previous denials.
abstract: Iranian oil minister Rostam Qasemi acknowledges for first time that petroleum exports and sales have fallen by at least 40 percent over past year, contradicting his previous denials and providing unusual public admission that cumulative impact of Western economic sanctions has grown more severe.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: The oil minister, Rostam Qasemi, acknowledged that petroleum exports and sales had fallen by at least 40 percent over the past year, contradicting his previous denials.

headline.seo: Iran’s Oil Exports and Sales Down 40 Percent, Official Admits
headline.main: Iranian Oil Minister Concedes Sanctions Have Hurt Exports
headline.print_headline: Iranian Oil Minister Concedes Sanctions Have Hurt Exports

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations
